intro: Picrasma napalensis, commonly known as the Napali yellowwood, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Simaroubaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces woody fruits that contain small, hard seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
